title: Guidelines: adopting climate technologies in the agrifood sector

organization.title: FAO
organization.name: fao
organization.description: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

groups.description: Climate change threatens our ability to ensure global food security, eradicate poverty and achieve sustainable development. Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activity and livestock are a significant driver of climate change, trapping heat in the earth's atmosphere and triggering global warming.
groups.title: Climate change adaptation and resilience
groups.name: climate-change-adaptation
food-security-and-nutrition
groups.title: Food Security and Nutrition
groups.description: The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the UN Decade of Action on Nutrition 2016â€“2025 call on all countries and stakeholders to act together to end hunger and prevent all forms of malnutrition by 2030.

name: guidelines-adopting-climate-technologies-in-the-agrifood-sector

resources.description: This methodology has been produced under the EBRD/FAO cooperation. In 2014, EBRD and FAO launched a project on Monitoring the adoption of key sustainable climate technologies in the agrifood sector. The project focused on the market penetration of energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. This methodology represents one of the main output of the project.
resources.name: Adoption of climate technologies in the agrifood sector

notes: This dataset contains documents that provide a practical methodology to enable countries or funding agencies to assess and monitor the market penetration of sustainable climate technologies and practices in agrifood chains.
